error.signature: Error: Invalid hook call. Hooks can only be called inside of the body of a function component. (class component)
error.regex: Invalid hook call.*function component|Hooks can only be called inside

verdict.summary: Using hooks (useState, useEffect) in a class component. Hooks are function-component only.

dead_ends.action: Wrap class component in a function component
dead_ends.why_fails: Over-engineering — convert the class component instead

dead_ends.action: Use a higher-order component to inject hooks
dead_ends.why_fails: Works but adds complexity — better to convert to function component

workarounds.action: Convert class component to function component to use hooks
workarounds.how:
// Class: this.state, this.setState
// Function: const [state, setState] = useState()

workarounds.action: If keeping class, use lifecycle methods instead: componentDidMount, componentDidUpdate
workarounds.how: Replace componentDidMount with useEffect(() => {...}, []) and componentDidUpdate with useEffect(() => {...}, [deps])
